result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant appears in person, in custody with both counsel, Robert Gardner and Matthew Krische.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Gardner represents on:  13CM406, 14CM204, 14CM85, 14CF13, 13CM310, 15CF180.  Attorney Krische represents on:  16CF205, 16CF193, 16CF194, 16CF192.  State has complied with victim notification.  Reading of amended information in 14CF13 is waived.  Judge cites the charge and potential penalties.  Will plea also to amended Ct 1 & Ct 3 - 16CF192, 16CF205 - Ct 3, 16CF193 - Ct 1.   Court reviewed all charges and potential penalties.  He understands.  Defendant pleads:  14CF13, Ct 3 - No Contest;  16CF192, Ct 1 - No Contest & Ct 3 - No Contest; 16CF193, Ct 1 - No Contest, 16CF205, Ct 3 - No Contest.  Attorney Gardner states the questionnaire needs to corrected and states he explained the difference to the defendant and he understands it.  Attorney Krische states he has discussed with his client and believes he understands.  Plea colloquy performed with defendant and felony warning given.  There are no restitution issues per ADA Inlow.  A PSI will be ordered.  Recommended sentencing stated by the Court and some discussion regarding such by counsel and ADA Inlow.  Court reviews elements of all 5 charges being plead to today.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding his waiver of rights.  Attorney Krische stipulates to the facts in the complaints to support pleas.  Attorney Gardner does as well in 14CF13.  Defendant confirms 3 prior convictions for misdemeanor bail jumping.  Court finds the defendant has entered his pleas and there are freely, voluntarily, and intelligently made; he understands the rights he's waiving and freely and voluntarily waives that right; finds a factual basis exists for each charge.  Court accepts his pleas and finds him guilty of those charges as plead to.  All other remaining counts/cases are dismissed and read-in along with 15CF180 (Judge Becker's case) is dismissed and read-in.  PSI ordered and is due within 45 days, sentencing to be set.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Gardner.   Advise JA of the Status after defendant's pleas on 2/1.

Status conference on January 23, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State. Defendant appeared through Attorney Krische and Attorney Gardner.  Attorney Krische says he has an agreement on his cases.  Set for a plea.  PSI will be requested. 

Attorney Gardner has a jury trial in front of Judge Goodman on another case.  Set those cases for STC on 1/23 at 3 pm.
From attorney Gardner to Judge Becker (Judge has copy)
Status conference on December 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Gardner.  Scheduled for STC on 11/21/16 at 3 pm

Covers case no. 15CF99, 15CF180 and 16CF22.   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: victim L. P. L. and with females under 18 years of age.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Must be on home arrest at all times, unless approved by the court.  Exceptions:  medical or legal appointments, religious functions or to get groceries.
to signature bond.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Waive reading of the information.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court on defendant's behalf.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Court reviewed the form and questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of the preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on Deputy J.S. to appear at 3/11 preliminary hearing.
PH on this one case, only, needed to be rescheduled due to the unavailability of the officer.
Preliminary hearing at 03-11-2016 02:45 pm

Defendant appeared in custody with counsel Robert Gardner.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defense is motioning the Court to reduce the $25,000 cash bond and to rescind the bond forfeiture ordered for the $5000 cash bond signed 12/12/15.  Requesting the $5000 cash bond be reinstated or the $25,000 be reduced.  DA Fox gives argument that there needs to be a sanction for not appearing and the previously ordered cash bond is appropriate and there are also 8 cases in front of Judge Goodman at this time.  Judge Becker reviewed the numerous cases that have had failure to appear warrants issued in the past; doesn't have a credible history that he will appear and he continues to violate the law.  Court orders the $5000 bond forfeiture rescinded and reinstates that bond.  Court orders the $25,000 cash bond is appropriate and will remain as previously ordered.  15CF61, 15CF99, 15CF180 are to be set for preliminary hearing.  Counsel are to schedule for 1 1/2 hours with the J.A. and status on other cases tracking.  15CF99 is the priority case for jury trial.
Preliminary hearing at 03-04-2016 01:30 pm
Motion hearing at 02-19-2016 01:45 pm

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with counsel, Robert Gardner appearing in person in the courtroom.  Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Attorney Gardner states he has not been retained on the new case 16CF22 yet but is sure he will be so he's appearing specially today; waives reading of the complaint; requests a preliminary hearing be scheduled within the time limits.  Court set prelim for 2-11-16 at 10:00 for 45 minutes.  15CF61, 15CF99, and 15CF180 will track with this case.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared by video from the jail.  Attorney Gardner appeared for the defendant.  Attonrey Gardner will be defendant's attorney for all open cases.  Attorney Gardner is privately retained.  Court confirmed Attorney Gardner will represent with the defendant. Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail with no counsel present.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-30-2015 09:30 am

Defendant appears by VTC from Jackson County Jail with no counsel present.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant states he's retained Robert Gardner on all his cases.  DA hasn't heard anything from either attorney Gardner or attorney Martinez.  Court instructs defendant to contact both attorneys so one of them appears.  Court believes that Mr. Martinez may have called stating he will be withdrawing.  Adjourned 2 weeks to 11-30-15 at 9:30.  Court instructs defendant to send a letter to both attorneys.  DA requests the bond remain as ordered.  Bond continues as previously ordered.
Adjourned initial appearance at 11-16-2015 09:30 am

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  No other appearances.  Defendant is in our jail.  Defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.  No counsel present.  Defendant will have Attorney Gardner as his counsel.   Court advised defendant to contact Attorney Martinez.  Defendant said he paid a retainer to Attorney Gardner.  Court advised Attorney Gardner will have to file notice of retainer.  Defendant to talk with Attorney Gardner.  Defendant said he wrote to Attorney Martinez and didn't receive a response.  AIA set for 11/16 at 9:30 am.  Track all cases together.
